articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Trump doubts North Korea leader will break promises on denuclearization
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Sunday he did not expect North Korean leader Kim Jong Un to break his promise about denuclearization, but conceded that he might.
articles.content:
ABOARD AIR FORCE ONE (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump said on Sunday he did not expect North Korean leader Kim Jong Un to break his promise about denuclearization, but conceded that he might. 
Kim Jong Un said last week there were no longer grounds fo… [+1177 chars]

articles.title: Trump, Johnson discuss situation in Iran, Iraq - White House
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump spoke with U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Sunday, discussing the current situation in Iraq and Iran, the White House said in a statement.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump spoke with U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Sunday, discussing the current situation in Iraq and Iran, the White House said in a statement.

articles.title: Oil extends gains on rising Mideast tensions
articles.description: Oil prices added to recent gains on Monday, with Brent nearly at $70 a barrel as escalating tensions in the Middle East fanned worries about disruptions to supplies.
articles.content:
SINGAPORE (Reuters) - Oil prices added to recent gains on Monday, with Brent nearly at $70 a barrel as escalating tensions in the Middle East fanned worries about disruptions to supplies.

articles.title: Trump threatens sanctions on Baghdad after lawmakers call on U.S. troops to leave
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump threatened sanctions against Baghdad on Sunday after Iraq's parliament called on U.S. troops to leave the country, and the president said if troops did leave, Baghdad would have to pay Washington for the cost of the air base there.

articles.author: Sharon Tam
articles.title: In Hong Kong's tranquil borderlands, two systems co-exist
articles.description: More than two decades after Hong Kong returned from British to Chinese rule in 1997, a long border fence still threads between mainland China and the city today.
articles.content:
HONG KONG (Reuters) - More than two decades after Hong Kong returned from British to Chinese rule in 1997, a long border fence still threads between mainland China and the city today.

articles.title: Mideast tensions send yen to three-month peak
articles.description: The safe-haven Japanese yen hit a three-month high on Monday, while gold soared as increasing tensions between Iran and the United States sent investors scurrying to less risky assets.
articles.content:
SINGAPORE (Reuters) - The safe-haven Japanese yen hit a three-month high on Monday, while gold soared as increasing tensions between Iran and the United States sent investors scurrying to less risky assets.

articles.title: Japan's December factory activity contracts at faster pace as output slumps - PMI
articles.description: Japanese manufacturing activity shrank at a faster pace in December than in the previous month as output slumped, underscoring growing pressure on businesses from sagging demand abroad and at home.
articles.content:

articles.title: Garrett out as head coach at Cowboys, say multiple reports
